creditline: Gift of John and Elizabeth Driscoll
description: black metal silhouette of rooster on post; mount L1.1 MS
text: Farmers who could not see the meeting hall or church weathervanes often made their own.  These early examples were usually two-dimensional and hand cut from wood or sheet metal, such as this highly stylized example of a rooster from Bucks County, Pennsylvania.
title: Rooster weathervane
